matador.ui

Class BoundaryToPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • matador.ui.BoundaryToPlayer

  • public class BoundaryToPlayer
extends Object
    Provides a boundary for communicating with the physical player.
    Author:
    Martin Caspersen

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Not used for this class.
        Parameters:
        args - not used.

      • getPlayerAccept

        public static boolean getPlayerAccept(Player activePlayer)
        Asks the physical player to enter a specific int. Checks whether the input matches the given int. Keeps trying until the physical player enters the correct int. Only accepts ints will throw an exception if anything but an int is entered.
        Parameters:
        activePlayer - the active Player.
        Returns:
        True if the player entered the correct int, cannot return false.

      • showString

        public static void showString(String output)
        Prints a given String to the console.
        Parameters:
        output - String to print to the console.

      • closeScanner

        public static void closeScanner()
        Closes the Scanner used to get input from the physical player.

      • landOnField

        public static void landOnField(Field field)
        Prints what field the player landed on and what effect that has on the balance.
        Parameters:
        field - the player landed on.

      • showStatus

        public static void showStatus(MatadorRafleBaeger baeger,
              Player[] players)
        Outputs the status of the Game to the physical player in the console. The format of the output is: Terning : , . . . Spiller : , . . .
        Parameters:
        baeger - containing the dice used in the game
        players - array containing the players in the game.
